imdb.plot outline: One in five people has a diagnosable mental disorder. For many families, the fear and shame associated with a diagnosis of mental illness can lead to isolation and suffering in silence. HEALTHY MINDS with Dr. Jeffrey Borenstein, award-winning series, once again, aims to educate the public about psychiatric conditions which affect so many people. The series humanizes mental health conditions through inspiring personal stories and interviews with leading researchers and experts, who provide the latest information about diagnosis and treatment. As Dr. Borenstein explains, "Everyone is touched by psychiatric conditions, either themselves or a loved one. Our goal is to share cutting edge information from experts along with personal experiences from people who have overcome psychiatric conditions. Now, more than ever, it is important to reduce stigma and encourage people who have a psychiatric condition not to suffer in silence but to seek help. I want people to know that with help, there is hope." 15 Episodes, 26:44 minutes 501 Youth and Mental Wellness: Lady Gaga's Born This Way Foundation 502 New Treatments for Youth Anxiety (Part One) 503 New Treatments for Youth Anxiety (Part Two) 504 Opioid Epidemic: What Every Family Needs to Know 505 Concussion: How To Protect Your Brain 506 Living with Bipolar Disorder 507 Schizophrenia: New Approaches to Recovery 508 Obsessive Compulsive Disorder 509 Technology and Mental Health 510 Postpartum Depression 511 Research and Evidenced Based Treatment 512 Youth and Mental Health: Early Intervention 513 Refractory Depression 514 Managing Stress 515 Brain Science and Art: Nobel Laurette Dr. Eric Kandel.
imdb.title: Healthy Minds with Dr. Jeffrey Borenstein
akas: Healthy Minds with Dr. Jeffrey Borenstein (United States)
plot: One in five people has a diagnosable mental disorder, but often fear and shame prevent people from seeking help. _Healthy Minds with Dr. Jeffrey Borenstein_ (qv) aims to remove the stigma of mental illness and that with help, there is hope.

One in five people has a diagnosable mental disorder. For many families, the fear and shame associated with a diagnosis of mental illness can lead to isolation and suffering in silence. HEALTHY MINDS with Dr. Jeffrey Borenstein, award-winning series, once again, aims to educate the public about psychiatric conditions which affect so many people. The series humanizes mental health conditions through inspiring personal stories and interviews with leading researchers and experts, who provide the latest information about diagnosis and treatment. As Dr. Borenstein explains, "Everyone is touched by psychiatric conditions, either themselves or a loved one. Our goal is to share cutting edge information from experts along with personal experiences from people who have overcome psychiatric conditions. Now, more than ever, it is important to reduce stigma and encourage people who have a psychiatric condition not to suffer in silence but to seek help. I want people to know that with help, there is hope." 15 Episodes, 26:44 minutes 501 Youth and Mental Wellness: Lady Gaga's Born This Way Foundation 502 New Treatments for Youth Anxiety (Part One) 503 New Treatments for Youth Anxiety (Part Two) 504 Opioid Epidemic: What Every Family Needs to Know 505 Concussion: How To Protect Your Brain 506 Living with Bipolar Disorder 507 Schizophrenia: New Approaches to Recovery 508 Obsessive Compulsive Disorder 509 Technology and Mental Health 510 Postpartum Depression 511 Research and Evidenced Based Treatment 512 Youth and Mental Health: Early Intervention 513 Refractory Depression 514 Managing Stress 515 Brain Science and Art: Nobel Laurette Dr. Eric Kandel.
